column4: when i do sudo fdisk -l shouldnt all disks attached to the system be listed?
No.. fdisk -l will list all PARTITIONS on the specified device.  eg. fdisk -l /dev/sda
i had a disk /dev/hda partition was /dev/hda1... its not mounting anymore. How do i list all drives and then remount it
Does /dev/hda1 still appear in  your /etc/fstab?
yes its there
Then do 'sudo mount -a'
In a terminal, not here ;-)
of course :)
i have tried that before... it says its mounting at /media/hda1... when i navigate to that directory theres nothing there
maybe the drive died :(
what does 'mount' show?
Does it show that partition is mounted?
no nothing relevant to /dev/hda1
'sudo umount /dev/hda1'  then do 'sudo mount /dev/hda1'
Failed to access '/dev/hda1': No such file or directory I should mention also that this occured immediatly after hardy heron upgrade. It might be better for me to take this to ubuntu+1
What version where you running before?
gutsy

Interesting.. Yeah, if it worked under gutsy it should under Hardy I would think.. but then again it IS alpha :)  I have no experience with Hardy though.. so yes, unless someone else here has any input...   Sorry
no worries, thanks a lot for your help. Ill migrate back to gutsy if i need to. Figured id just try to help
Glad to help.. Just hope you haven't lost any critical data
everything critical is backed up :) lucky.
